review: Chromecast is really cool.  However, you may want to upgrade your router; as I've found that Chromecast slows everything else down on my network.  I have trouble streaming HD video, but I believe that's a function of my substandard router.  My family watches TV during dinner, and this item allows us to spread out in the living room, and not huddle over the laptop.
author: Tubbins

review: I have to agree with so many other reviews, this is a great idea, but is still a Beta version implementation.It intermittently drops connections to your source machine, and takes several steps to reconnect.The content can come only from Chrome Browser, although the way it passes off Netflix, YouTube, and Hulu URIs directly to the device is a good approach and seems to work well. It will still stutter and pause on some streaming content.I was largely interested in using it for meetings and presentations, but it still requires some local WiFi setup, although not too much. When sending PowerPoint presentations, I could not find any way t o have it shown in regular full-screen mode, it always keeps the slide index on the left as one would do during development. (There are workarounds, converting to full-screen locally, and using a different display mode, but the standard "casting" mode should work better.)But overall it also has limited content sources - for example who wants to subscribe to Hulu and pay to watch commercials?I look forward to when this develops into its full potential - the idea is a great one!

author: Jani Into

review: First of the good- the thing is tiny.  Compared to roku, apple tv, etc, this thing is super small.- it works.  It is very simple to operate and begin using- its portable.  Unlike other products, when you are done with it you can simply unplug it from your tv and go.- its power comes from usb.  This is perhaps the one of the best parts about this thing.  You do not have to plug this into the wall for it to work, but simply plug it into a usb port also on the back of most TV's.  the usb cable is included!- PRICE!  I mean come on, seriously... you can turn your tv into a smart tv for under 40 dollars!The not so good- There is only a very few apps that work with this so far: Youtube and Netflix.  (also it casts whatever is on your chrome browswer)Suggestions:- It would be great if they could expand the apps to also work with MLB, NHL gamecenter, and slingbox to name a few.In the end, you can not beat the price of this device.  Even with the limited app support I would recommend this product.  Once more apps are supported, this thing will amazing.
